messages.title: I will oppose £500k cuts to local schools
messages.content: Schools in the Eastney & East Southsea catchment area will be forced to cut frontline teaching posts as the Conservative Government slashes funding for our local primary schools...

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will oppose £500k cuts to local schools and fight against cuts which harm our children's future.
Committed to addressing serious flooding risks and erosion of green spaces.
Support building international agreements on climate change and renewables.

issues.education: Will oppose £500k cuts to local schools, protect Pupil Premium and free school meals.
issues.environment: Joined Friends of the Earth in Portsmouth...

community.content: Environmental issues must not be ignored in this election.

politicalExperience.achievements: Secured funding to rebuild the city's sea defences, reduce congestion and air pollution.

contactInformation.address: Portsmouth Liberal Democrats, FREEPOST RRZT-LBHE-XXHU, 220 Fratton Road, Portsmouth PO1 5HH

images.caption: Lib Dem Candidate for Portsmouth South Gerald Vernon-Jackson listening to concerns about cuts...
Gerald & local Lib Dems regularly join Southsea Beach Cleans

leaflet.additionalNotes: On 8th June, vote for an MP who will always put Portsmouth people first

examples: I am really worried that environmental issues will be pushed aside in this election and that is wrong.
Local Lib Dem Councillor for Eastney & Craneswater Mathew Winnington
Schools in the Eastney & East Southsea catchment area will be forced to cut frontline teaching posts...
Environmental issues must not be ignored in this election.
The Lib Dem Secretary of State for Energy and Climate Change was instrumental in building international support for the Paris Climate Change Agreement in 2015.
Since 2015, the Conservatives have systematically unpicked our policies and damaged the green industries which had been flourishing.

nonPolicyAttributes.localness: Gerald Vernon-Jackson will always put the interests of Portsmouth first.

examples: Gerald Vernon-Jackson will always put the interests of Portsmouth first.
